info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 13 at 1:24PM MDT by NWS Pocatello
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM PRODUCING FREQUENT LIGHTNING, SMALL HAIL, AND VERY HEAVY RAINFALL WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHEASTERN CASSIA COUNTY THROUGH 200 PM MDT... At 122 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles east of Almo, or 18 miles south of Malta, moving southeast at 10 MPH. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 MPH, pea to penny size hail, frequent lightning, and very heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Bridge. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. If you observe flooding, debris flows, hail, or wind damage, please report your observations to the National Weather Service in Pocatello via phone, email, or social media, as soon as it is safe to do so.
